statements.name: PROC EXPORT
statements.description: Exports SAS data sets to an external data file.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: identifies the input SAS data set with either a one- or two-level SAS name (library and member name). If you specify a one-level name, by default, the EXPORT procedure uses either the USER library (if assigned) or the WORK library.

arguments.name: OUTFILE=
arguments.description: specifies the complete path and file name or a fileref for the output PC file, spreadsheet, or delimited external file. A fileref is a SAS name that is associated with the physical location of a file. To assign a fileref, use the FILENAME statement.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the table name of the output DBMS table. If the name does not include special characters (such as question marks), lowercase characters, or spaces, you can omit the quotation marks. Note that the DBMS table name might be case sensitive.

arguments.name: DBMS=
arguments.description: specifies the type of external data source that the EXPORT procedure creates. To export to a DBMS table, you must specify the DBMS option by using a valid database identifier.

arguments.name: CSV
arguments.description: The output data source is a comma-separated delimited file. The file extension is .CSV.

arguments.name: DBF
arguments.description: dBASE 5.0, IV, III+, and III files. The file extension is .dbf.

arguments.name: DBFMEMO
arguments.description: dBASE 5.0, IV, III+, and III files with memos.

arguments.name: DLM
arguments.description: The output data source is a delimited file. You can use DELIMITER='char' to specifiy the type of data to export.

arguments.name: DTA
arguments.description: Stata file. The file extension is .dta.

arguments.name: JMP
arguments.description: The output data source is a JMP file, Version 7 or later format. The file extension is .JMP.

arguments.name: PARADOX
arguments.description: Paradox DB files. The file extension is .db.

arguments.name: SAV
arguments.description: SPSS files, compressed and uncompressed binary files. The file extension is .sav.

arguments.name: TAB
arguments.description: The output data source is a tab delimited file. The file extension is .txt.

arguments.name: XLS
arguments.description: Microsoft Excel 97, 2000, 2002, or 2003 spreadsheet using file formats. The file extension is .xls.

arguments.name: XLSX
arguments.description: Excel 2007, 2010, and later spreadsheet, using .xlsx file format. The file extension is .xlsx.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: specifies a variable label name.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: overwrites an existing file.

arguments.name: (SAS data set options)
arguments.description: specifies SAS data set options.

statements.name: DBENCODING
statements.description: Indicates the encoding used to save data in JMP files.

arguments.name: 12-char
arguments.description: indicates the encoding used to save data in JMP files. Encoding maps each character in a character set to a unique numeric representation, which results in a table of code points. A single character can have different numeric representations in different encodings. This value can be up to 12 characters long.

statements.name: DELIMITER
statements.description: Specifies the delimiter to separate columns of data in the output file.

arguments.name: char
arguments.description: specifies the delimiter to use to separate values in the output file. You can specify the delimiter as a single BYTE character or as a hexadecimal value. For example, if you want columns of data to be separated by an ampersand, specify DELIMITER='&'. A single character that requires two bytes to be represented in a DBCS environment is not valid.

arguments.name: ''x
arguments.description: specifies the delimiter to use to separate values in the output file. You can specify the delimiter as a single BYTE character or as a hexadecimal value. For example, if you want columns of data to be separated by an ampersand, specify DELIMITER='&'. A single character that requires two bytes to be represented in a DBCS environment is not valid.

statements.name: FMTLIB
statements.description: Write SAS format values defined in the format catalog to the JMP file for the value labels.

arguments.name: libref.format-catalog
arguments.description: specifies the format catalog to be written to the JMP file.

statements.name: META
statements.description: Writes SAS metadata information to the JMP file. (Deprecated)

arguments.name: libref.member-data-set
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the metadata information to be written to the JMP file.

statements.name: PUTNAMES
statements.description: Writes SAS variable names as column headings to the first row of the exported data file.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description:
specifies that the EXPORT procedure is to do the following tasks:
• Write the SAS variable names as column names (or headings) to the first row of the exported data file.
• Write the first row of the SAS data set to the second row of the exported data file.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the EXPORT procedure is to write the first row of SAS data set values to the first row of the exported data file.
